text:
The Gray Man is a very mixed movie for me even though I really wanted to like it.

I knew about its reputation, but went in hopeful because I liked the films the Russos, Stephen McFeely and Christopher Marcus made before. This one bleeds from several wounds. First of all the story is generic despite the pretty cool premise. If a mocie has a premise similar to this, I'm going to watch, but you have got to inject something fresh, something unexpected into it to make it intriguing. The characters are generic too with almost nothing interesting. The dialogues are sometimes painfully unnatural. It's also written like it couldn't be shot practically under like $500 million. There are too many locations and over the top actions sequences. Because of that these actions sequences don't really hold value or stakes.

The directing is mixed. Maybe I only say this because of their previous work, but this feels like it wants to be a superhero movie. Every other shot wants to be epic. It's just not fitting. I loved the direction of the first two scenes, which made me very hopeful for the rest of the film. But as I said, it was quite a downhill from that. The lighting would be pretty good, but the constantly noticable CGI just overwhelmed me. The editing is not too good, as I said there are too many locations and they cut between them incredibly fast, but it's still boeing. The score is pretty good at times. The cast is great and the acting is okay.

The Gray Man is sadly as bad as they say.

Good as a brain off action flick. Other than that the characters seem to teleport all over the world in the space of minutes, action scenes are cut every second, story's mid. Only reason I watched this was because it was highly rated but I have to leave my first review. If you're looking for good cinema you won't find it here.
This movie was so dope. Evans was so damn hilarious.

Bourne reincarnated. A great cast saves it in a way so well done to the casting team. You get lost in the plot but it ends up making sense towards the latter parts of the film. Some good action scenes then some questionable CGI. Overall worth a watch but not ground breaking
This is one of the most underrated action movies of all time. I love it.
This was excellent, far better than most of the John Wick movies. This gets a deserved full house
Wow, wow wow very very good movie... When is Grey Man 2 coming up?
Great movie. Rewatchable several times over
Overall solid movie. Didn’t buy Ryan Gosling as an action hero. Chris Evan’s stole the movie.
Enjoyable film to watch with a great cast. It ran about 15-20 minutes too long with an average ending.

You know, I went into this with pretty solid expectations. When I finished it, I was like, "man, that was pretty underwhelming." The plot was very generic and predictable, some of the characters were useless, and even some things had me questioning if it was cool. I will say the cast performances were really good. Ryan Gosling, Chris Evans, and Ana de Armas did well. Just everything else was very average.

A great action movie! Set pieces are awesome, the hand to hand combat is incredible, and not to mention an amazing cast. Chris Evan’s as a villain is perfect in which he plays a character that is impossible to stop vs ryan gosling who play a character that is impossible to catch.

This was a good action movie with all the bells and whistles. One scene was way over the top and a bit hollywoodish, but the acting and camera work was great. Especially on a rainy Sunday, this would make people happy.
Again critics continue to complain, yet I see this as if Man on Fire ended the opposite way and was much more actiony though.
Great fun and action with a lot of heart (mainly due to Julia Butters).

I really liked this movie. I feel that it is a very good movie since it has a very good plot and the actors also do their job very well, making sure that we do not lose interest and keep our attention on it from the beginning to the end. 
~Laura Moreno
It’s a solid action movie with an okay story line. Great cast, would recommend.
Extremely stupid & over-the-top, this throwback to 80s & 90s action blockbusters is a hollow but mostly entertaining movie.
Loved this.  The action,  the cast,  the effects, the whole show was brilliant.  Love this cast.

Chris Evans is a joy to watch having a whale of a time playing a psycho of 90s-Oldman proportions. Otherwise this film is totally forgettable action sludge. How many times do you want to repeat the "mortally wounded person does a thing" trope? Surely not 3 times in the same film. I almost fell asleep during one of the action set pieces. I miss the days when Ryan Gosling only made cool films.
